step1.sentence: She fell for his kindness immediately and agreed to go on a date.

step2.story: He received an email claiming he had won a prize and almost fell for it. Luckily, his friend recognized the classic scam and stopped him before he clicked the link.

step3.story: On April Fools' Day, the office manager announced there would be a mandatory meeting at 7 a.m. the following day. Most of the team groaned and started rearranging their morning plans. Only two people suspected it might be a joke and waited. The others fell for it completely and showed up the next morning confused and slightly annoyed.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 누군가에게 빠져들다, 사랑에 빠지다; 속임수에 넘어가다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 감정적으로 누군가에게 끌리거나 사랑에 빠질 때, 또는 속임수에 속을 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: fall(빠지다)과 for(~에 대해)가 결합하여 무언가에 완전히 빠져들어간다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적(사랑에 빠지다)과 부정적(속다) 두 의미를 모두 가집니다. 문맥으로 구분합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I can't believe you fell for that old trick; it was so obvious.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 오래된 속임수에 넘어가다니 믿을 수 없어요. 완전히 뻔했잖아요.
